relevance_notes: Shows resilience mediates emotional/behavioural wellbeing among children exposed to adversity, motivating H1 + support-focused hypotheses.
Parental career support boosts occupational engagement via major satisfaction/career adaptability, aligning with H2 on guidance and adult work satisfaction.
Nationwide longitudinal evidence that childhood neighborhood quality drives adult depression via emotional neglect, reinforcing H4's continuity premise.
Finds adverse childhood experiences elevate problematic internet use in young adults through hostility/loneliness, underscoring digital sequelae of adversity for H1 framing.
Indonesian study showing parental involvement + tech access shapes early digital literacy, supporting H3's focus on early computer use and later outcomes.
